comments.commentBody:
Mr. Kristof, thank you for once again telling it like it is. As you know, US policy on Sudan, affects the behavior of President al-Bashir and his party. Consistent attention, consequences, and coordination with our allies curb their genocidal acts and human rights violations. Engagement and incentives without pressure and consequences embolden them. Millions of lives are at stake.

To Rajiv in Palo Alto, millions of Americans and many Republicans do care.

I HAVE NO doubt what mr brisbane said in his column is true. however, i'm reminded of athletes and actors who always talk about challenges, great roles etc etc and never say anything about pay. the only exceptions which come to mind are michael caine and sean connery.....

Thank you, lightseybl, for getting right what the NYT has gotten horribly wrong.  Katrina hit Mississippi!  The Mississippi Gulf Coast was virtually washed away by a 35' storm surge and nearly 1/4 of the homes in the state were destroyed or damaged.  Yet, instead of erupting into anarchy, Mississippians pulled together.  Why are you ignoring that real story, Times?

Dr. King also said, "we will be able to go this
additional distance and achieve the ideal, the goal of the new
age, the age of social justice."

Mr. Beck tells Christians that they ought to run from any church that speaks of 'social justice.' Somehow, in his/their effort to claim the mantle of Dr. King, Mr. Beck will manage to claim that liberals have distorted the phrase and that what Dr. King REALLY meant by 'social justice' is now better captured in his new phrase 'equal justice.' But we can see the hypocrisy.
The Tea Party is the best thing that could have happened to the Republican Party - the snake is now beginning to eat it's own tail.
What part of "content of their heart and not the color of their skin" don't you understand?
We need to eradicate the misiniformation of Beck and Palin 'By any means necessary'.

Virtually everything the Tea Party people state is rationalization. Do they really think they will make a single individual who is not already sympathetic think they're not racists? Still no ideas, just emotions like anger, hatred and fear. Clearly, their biggest problem is the charge of racism, and the charge will stick as long as they claim Obama is a Muslim and Islam is bad for America.

I've noticed no one gets on stage to announce the sun will rise tomorrow morning.

Mr. Beck did not know this was the anniversary of Dr. King's speech?
There's a couple of things worrisome about that. Mr. Beck is either unaware or uninterested in our nation's history (not particularly a strong quality for a leader of political organization) or Mr. Beck is lying about the timing and place of this rally being a coincidence.
Liar, ignorant, liar, ignorant- Which characteristic is it the Tea Party organization prefers in their representative?
Divine intervention? As if God needs this rally to happen! It's called the right to assemble on public property!

This article fails to mention the Koch brothers who are probably even more important than Dick Armey's Freedom Works and A. Breitbart's activities as a basis for the "Tea Party" movement. David and Charles Koch are billionaire oil magnates who inherited the oil business created by their father and have been using their inherited wealth to sustain right wing causes for many years. Their father was a founder of the John Birch society which claimed that John Kennedy and even Dwight Eisenhower were "communists". The sons are dedicated to undermining the Obama administration just as the father tried to do with Kennedy. I wonder how many "Tea Party" and Beck followers know that they are acting as stooges for people like the Koch brothers.

http://www.newyorker.com...
I hope it comes off non-violently.  That is a lot frustrated gun zealots packed into a small area.  I assume National Park Police are calling in sick by the dozen.
A 21st Century minstrel show in Washington DC.  How fitting that it should come from the Tea Party and their Republican allies.  "Grass roots" indeed.

It is unbelievable how incredible gullible the main stream press must think Americans are. The ease with which it claims "the racist Tea Party" when the opposite is true is stunning.
Those who claim this rally is "insensitive" yet have no issue with mosque clearly do not see the whole picture.
And as King's niece points out - this is exactly the kind of rally King would support. This is not coopted by Beck - it is coopted by those who think only Democrats have the right to convene.
They're not racist. They are just ignorant.

So the Tea Party is claiming the mantle of the Rev. Martin Luther King. That's rich. That's like Sarah Palin claiming the mantle of Barbara Jordan. It never fails to amaze me how truly/totally ignorant and hateful many Americans are. No wonder the rest of the world either hates us or is deeply suspicious of our motives.
Advertising note: This horror show at the Lincoln Memorial is brought to you by Fox News, since the two main speakers are paid entertainers for Fox.

I do not particularly like Beck however this is America and he has rights. However, my issue is for someone who claims to be such a history buff and is always doing some historical (yet often revisionist) piece on his show, how could he not know the date's importance? Despite his selective memory he still has the right to do what he wants to do today. My issue is that he and the rest of Tea Party claim that they want to reclaim their civil rights that have been taken away by the government. Are we in the Twilight Zone?
Under the Patriot Act, passed by the last administration, many civil liberties can be in affect taken away when it is pleasing to the Feds. American citizens had phones tapped, internet access recorded and a host of other liberties infringed upon. Hmmmmm, where was Beck and the rest of the conservative right when this was going on? Where were they when became mired in another "Vietnam" over in Iraq and Afghanistan? Where were they when the Republican administration under Mr. Bush basically destroyed the balanced budget left by Mr. Clinton? Where were they when the excess and abuse of laws and the good will of the American people by the "robber barons" of Wall Street put not only America but the entire global economy near the point of collapse?

Beck and other like him were on their shows talking about everything else but those issues.
Yet know when the present administration is trying to correct the abuses that were allowed to fester for 8 years now they suddenly want to return to ignore federal government and basically abolish many programs that help those who need help?

The fact is Beck,Palin, and others like them will never understand the plight of most Americans. They get paid millions of dollars to show and to speak ad to spread they vitriol and rantings. They go home richer. The rest of us still have to wake up Monday morning and wonder if we have enough money to make it through the month.
They can claim that the conservative right is not racist. I would really love to believe that but actions speak louder than words. Since Pres. Obama had entered the White House suddenly ( if you believe the conservative right) all is wrong in America. Yet, the fact is that things were much worse when Mr. Obama first began than now. The fact is what happened in the economy was disastrous on an epic scale. Things were made much worse by the many thieves like Madoff who fleeced many hand working people. However, when Congress tried to put regulate the financial sector the Republicans said no. Beck and those of his ilk then claim Obama is a socialist, communist, Muslim who loves Hitler who needs to go back to Kenya. Those type of statements just show their ignorance. I am a history major and I hear those type of phrases they make my ears cringe. When it comes down to it it looks like the Republicans have a severe case of being a sore loser or they are racist or at the very least only want someone from the "old boys" club in the White House.

I am not stating that everything the present administration has done is perfect but doing is better than just talking and making noise. Always voting no against bills does not help the public. Making all immigrants look un-American is distasteful. Showing all Muslims as terrorists and stirring up anti-Islamic feelings is reprehensible. Claiming that when the Republicans are back in power that they can simply repeal all the laws passed just shows a lack of common sense since repeals of federal law do not work that way.

Beck, Palin, and the rest can all claim to be wanting the best for America. The best thing for this nation is stop fear mongering, stop saying "no" and bring some real ideas to the table. They need to stop with this whole "going back to the good old days and a return to the foundation of the Constitution". Look the Constitution was not perfect hence the amendments. They want to do away with the 13,14, and 15th amendments? Well, the day that happens is the day I leave this country ( and I am born citizen). That kind of vitriol leave a bad taste in a listener's mouth. This nation was built on the back's of immigrants. Without immigration the USA would not be what it is. Yes, immigration reform is needed but there is no need to label all immigrants as criminals.

The conservative right is not welcoming to people who are of a different color or religion. Oh yeah they make have their "token" minority but the rest really only speak for the rich whites.
Meanwhile so many Tea Party members soak up their nonsense. Yet while they are struggling to put food on the table or to pay for health care, the Becks and Palins ( and their ilk) are fine with their large bank accounts.

The Conservative right...in touch with the American public? What a oxymoron. It is just the wolves leading sheep.
I'm disgusted and embarrassed.  And I'm not even American.

I have read several comments that congratulate Mr. Beck for coming together with other tea party members to celebrate Martin Luther King. The simple fact of the matter is that Glenn Beck did not even know that they were having a rally at the spot and on the anniversary of that famous speech. That's how little the tea party cares about what Martin Luther King did for the Civil Rights Movement.
Klansmen Have a Dream Too.
Tea is to Taxes as Time is to America's History. America is best when she's answering the true call to Freedom. You all shall overcome means that the rest of us may also.
Where are all of the "Hallowed Ground" people when you need them?
One can only hope that Glen Beck and Sarah Palin refrain from saying their dreams
This article is completely biased NY Times tripe. It's pretty clear to me where this write stands.

It is well known that the old civil right activists are part of the Democratic machine, which is in power and show signs of crumbling. They seems to be desperate to see Foxnews and Beck are doing well, so they had to accuse the conservative media as 'racist', which even V.P. Joe Biden said is not true.
